content.webTitle: Win sets of classic HG Wells books

fields.headline: Win sets of classic HG Wells books
fields.bodyText: Journalist, sociologist and historian HG Wells made his debut as a novelist with The Time Machine in 1895, a parody of English class division and a satirical warning that human progress is not inevitable. His successive novels pioneered a new kind of writing - science fiction. Phoenix Paperbacks have reissued six classic novels by the 'father of science fiction' with new cover designs and Guardian Unlimited Books have five sets of the books to give away, courtesy of Phoenix. Each set comprises: The Time Machine The War of the Worlds The Island of Dr Moreau The Invisible Man When the Sleeper Wakes The First Men in the Moon For the chance to win the six books, email books.competition@guardianunlimited.co.uk marking your subject heading 'HG Wells', by 12 noon on Thursday April 15, with your name, address and the answer to the following question: In The Time Machine, in which year in the future does the Time Traveller find himself?
